evidence.title: README (segment 2)
evidence.excerpt:
Flow CLI brings Flow to your terminal. Easily interact with the network and build your dapps.
Read the docs¬ª

Report Bug ¬∑ Contribute ¬∑ Read Guidelines

evidence.title: README (segment 3)
evidence.excerpt: To install the Flow CLI, follow the [installation instructions](https://developers.flow.com/tools/flow-cli/install) on the Flow documentation website.

evidence.title: README (segment 4)
evidence.excerpt: You can find the CLI documentation on the [CLI documentation website](https://developers.flow.com/tools/flow-cli).

evidence.title: README (segment 5)
evidence.excerpt: ## Features The Flow CLI is a command line tool that allows you to interact with the Flow blockchain. Read about supported commands in the [CLI documentation website](https://developers.flow.com/tools/flow-cli).

evidence.title: README (segment 6)
evidence.excerpt: üëã Welcome Flow developer! If you are starting a new flow project use our super commands, start by running 'flow init'.

evidence.excerpt: üî• Super Commands generate Generate template files for common Cadence code init Start a new Flow project

evidence.title: v2.14.2
evidence.excerpt: ## ‚¨ÜÔ∏è Install or Upgrade Follow the [Flow CLI installation guide](https://developers.flow.com/tools/flow-cli/install) for instructions on how to install or upgrade the CLI. - Update to lint v1.7.4 and languageserver v1.9.2 (#2270) @turbolent - Switch wallet creation endpoint to lilico.app (#2271) @jribbink ## üõ† Improvements - Change "mainnet" in template to "mainnet-fork" (#2268) @jribbink

evidence.title: v2.14.2-evm-manipulation-poc.0
evidence.excerpt: POC build with custom `InternalEVM` contract deployed for enhanced testing capabilities. **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/onflow/flow-cli/compare/v2.14.1...v2.14.2-evm-manipulation-poc.0
